summary: This document is an internal email chain among U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel discussing a media inquiry from Fox News. The inquiry, prompted by a '60 Minutes' segment, asks whether it is true that there are no photos of Jeffrey Epstein's body in his cell. The consensus among the email participants is to decline to comment, with one noting the statement appears true to their knowledge.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the Fox News inquiry regarding the absence of photos of his body in his cell after his death, which was discussed in a '60 Minutes' segment.

events.title: '60 Minutes' segment on Epstein's death
events.description: A '60 Minutes' television piece aired discussing the 'murder' of Jeffrey Epstein, prompting subsequent media inquiries.

events.title: Fox News inquiry about Epstein body photos
events.description: Fox News contacted the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York asking to confirm if it was true that there were no photos of Jeffrey Epstein's body in his cell.

keyFacts: Fox News made a media inquiry to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the absence of photos of Jeffrey Epstein's body in his cell.
The inquiry was prompted by a '60 Minutes' television segment that aired discussing Epstein's death as a 'murder'.
Internal email correspondence shows prosecutors planned to decline to comment on the inquiry, with one noting the statement about no photos was 'true to our knowledge'.
The document reveals ongoing media and public scrutiny regarding the circumstances and investigation of Epstein's death in August 2019.
The email chain is dated January 6, 2020, indicating the inquiry occurred several months after Epstein's death.
